direction.raw_text: To do this. Emma opens her arms wide and pulls Penelope into a hug. She looks at Alice and Meg over Penelope's shoulder, and then closes her eyes with genuine emotion for a beat, pulling back to smile into Penelope's grateful, tear-streaked face.

direction.raw_text: Now... Friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (raising a glass) To friends! old and new! Emma seizes Penelope's hand from across the table, placing it in Domenico's as she drunkenly sings the old Girl Scout song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Make new friends and keep the old, one is silver and the other's gold!" Alice and Jean-Pierre lean toward each other intimately' across the packed, lively table of PARTY-GOERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, no one really lives here. Monte Carlo. It's like Hong Kong. People merely come and go. People like me. Well, and then, people like yourself. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 64.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice nods to a WAITER who arrives to refill her Champagne glass, pouring as Jean-Pierre speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People like me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People with money. This is why I come. I help assuage their guilt when I remind them that there are children in this world who do not have clean water to drink, while they drink Champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that works? Jean-Pierre blinks, then bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I take myself far too seriously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I'm sorry, I didn't mean--. I've seen the pictures of the schools. The work you do is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm afraid I talk about it because I myself am not that interesting... (a hand on her arm) I'd rather know about you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Well. You know. I...do what I can, here and there. A little volunteer work... She turns to her Champagne, rolling her eyes at herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, brother. Meg sits further down the length of all the tables laid end to end, beside Giorgio, who has pulled his chair close, draping an arm casually across the back of hers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, wait. You're a man, right? (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 65.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Giorgio laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know: I'm funny. But, see if you can answer something for me. Ten years you're married, to the girl you dated in high school. I'm talking the girl you lost your virginity to, the one who gave you two great kids that you're just crazy about. Then one morning, what? You wake up, and out of the blue, it's like, "Oh, hey, honey, I think I'm in love with this other woman..." (PAUSES) His patrol partner. A beat as Giorgio shakes his head sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was his partner. Giorgio takes Meg hand, more in comfort than come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heart feels betrayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (telling a secret) I feel like I failed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you this: A man...he will always love the mother of his children. Meg blinks, taking this in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you must kiss someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I see--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To break the spell. You must! Then you will be free. A plate of beautifully arranged langoustine is placed on the table in front of Meg. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 66.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry, 'I didn't order-- She looks up to find Bernard standing in chef's whites.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles, nods) Madame Kelly. He heads toward for the kitchen before she can say anything. Emma pours sloppy glasses of Champagne for her companions as though playing a game of tag, spilling wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're my friend...and you're my friend. . .and you're my-- She turns with the bottle to find Nikolai who has materialized beside her on the long banquette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hey! You were at the party! Do you work here, too? Nikolai cheerfully shakes his head, holds up her purse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Did I forget that? Wow, what a lifesaver! Thanks!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ti takaya vaskhititel'naya. Emma sets the bottle down to concentrate on Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not from here, are you? (OVER-ENUNCIATING) I'm Emm--. My name is Cordelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (points to himself) Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice and Jean-Pierre walk along, side by side, their hands nearly touching, among the rest of the restaurant party. Alice looks up, taking in the bowl of pre-dawn sky, and glances over at Jean-Pierre who watches her. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 67.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stars are still out. Ahead, Emma breaks away from Penelope and Domenico, leaving the two to walk on together as she comes back toward Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Meg? Alice looks around and sees Giorgio walking alone among the strolling party guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought she was right behind us--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernard takes a tray of dishes from his FATHER (70's, striking resemblance) who enters from the dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa, sit down. Rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernard enters with the tray, stopping when he sees Meg examining a menu by the front door of the empty bistro.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do cook. Bernard shrugs, smiling as he comes forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You enjoyed your meal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adding the fresh orange; nice. Bernards nods, accepting the compliment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, a little fennel would've been "wow."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time, you cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg! What are you doing? Come on! We're going to watch-- (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 68.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma and Alice stop short just outside in the street, pausing as they sense they've interrupted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were--. We're going to watch the sunrise. Meg hesitates, turning between her friends and Bernard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should not miss it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice and Emma walk with Meg down the narrow street at the end of which the party guests stroll and Jean-Pierre waits for Alice, with Penelope, Domenico and Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy from the market?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is so cute! And a cook--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chef .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're single now! Meg slows to a stop, stands a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm single. I'm single, now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Julia Child didn't take her first cooking class until she was thirty seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's coming, Cordelia! The sun!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 69. is EXT. PLACE DE CASINO -- DAWN Alice, Emma and Meg, arms linked, round the corner into the square with the rest of the party guests, just as the very edge of the sun crests the horizon of the open sea. Alice turns to Meg and Emma, sharing this moment so far beyond anything they could have dreamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd be getting up now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we were home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, we're not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia! The spell is broken by a TRIO OF PAPARAZZI who spring to life by the hotel's entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia! Cordelia!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, good! I want a picture! Of the three of us! All of us! The paparazzi swarm from the steps towards Emma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the fountain! She runs for the sprays of water, pulling Alice and Meg, and the paparazzi meet them, flashing away. Leaning against the fountain's balustrade, Emma gestures for everyone to join them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penelope! Come on. I want one with everybody! Penelope, Domenico and Jean-Pierre join with other members of the group and Emma lines them all up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay! Ready? One, two-- (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She spots Nikolai observing at a short distance. EMMA (CONT'D) Wait! Wait! Niki! He shakes his head, bashful, but Emma gestures him over, swinging her arms wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikolai, you, too! I need all my friends--Whoops! Her feet zip out from beneath her and she sails backwards over the balustrade, reaching for Alice and Meg, pulling them with her as the camera's flash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: airliner touches down on the tarmac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice's repaired suitcase tumbles off the conveyer belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. Pardon me. Richard skirts around a man with a newspaper to retrieve the bag and heads for customs. As Richard exits, the man folds his newspaper to its bold headline: SCOTT MAKES A SPLASH!, and a huge photograph of Emma, Alice and Meg laughing together in the fountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma enters from the bedroom in a swimsuit and wrap, to find Alice hanging up the desk phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, have you seen my sandals?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, there's a two o'clock and a four o'clock train to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Train? Where are you going? Alice looks up and takes in Emma's costume. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 71.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to the beach. With Penelope. Meg enters through the suite's door carrying a bakery bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breakfast is here! There's this fantastic bakery around the corner. I've already had three brioche. And I saw the greatest little shop for the kids, but they weren't open
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off Alice's look) What's going on? (TO EMMA) What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. She's talking about train schedules... Emma trails off as she and Meg and Alice look between each other in confusion, each processing for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to start packing, right? If we're going back to Paris--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to Paris?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was the plan--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What plan?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not staying for the auction?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were just going to come down, take a look around and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was before we knew it was for a charity. Remember the kids? (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 72.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Africa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ones we stole a trip from? The kids who are paying for this room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, what's with you? We'll pay for the room--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're rich!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I'm the only one worried about the fact that we're lying to everyone we've met?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lying? To who? Jean-Pierre?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one who said we had to go to the casino--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now I'm apparently the only who's worried we might get caught.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's in Iceland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of her friends is bound to find out, or her family--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got friends. The doorbell rings and they turn their heads in unison, then look to each other with sudden alarm. A beat. Emma goes to the door, finding Penelope, also dressed for the beach, who holds up the newspaper with it's fountain photo. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 73.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my god! We look great! (ushers Penelope in) Alice, look! Alice takes the paper, Meg reading over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have got to get that in the yearbook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yearbook?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penelope, could you excuse us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. of course. Where--? Alice shows Penelope to the bedroom, closes the door and spins to face Emma and Meg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I'm talking about! This is why we have to go--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it mean we have to stay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, this is so typical. Just because it's not on your map, 'cause you didn't plan it--. We all agree to take this adventure and then you won't jump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't--? Jump? Meg drops into a chair, mumbling an aside to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know how Richard must feel. Alice comes to a full stop and gapes at Meg, stung. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 74.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you're sure one to talk. Meg's eyes flick up to Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't even bring yourself to buy a pair of jeans anymore--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, you know what? Let's just pack. It's not fun anymore. Alice, if you think we should go, then that's what we're gonna do. You're in charge. Meg scoffs, an exasperated exhale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. Not anymore I'm not. You want to go to the beach? Go to the beach. You want to go the market? Go! "Liberte, egalite, fraternite!"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that mean? Alice snatches up her purse and heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means everyone should do exactly what they want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, wait! Where are you--? You're not going back to Paris--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me? No. I'm going to have an adventure. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 75.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She exits, slamming the door behind her. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (off Emma's look) Don't look at me like that. The door opens, and Alice re-enters, striding across the room for the desk, not looking at either Emma or Meg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just--. My guide book. She picks up her book and crosses back to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard steps from the hotel with a MANAGER (50's) who pantomimes that he recognizes Alice from the snapshot Richard shows him, but has no idea where she could be. Richard pulls out a map to point at a random spot and the manager gestures up the street, down the street, shrugging: She could be anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, amid a crowd of tourists, only half watches the changing of the guards outside the palace gates. She snaps herself out of her distraction with a shake of her head and turns to the marked pages in her guide book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice? She glances up to find Carl and Deedee from the tour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We thought that was you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Carl! Deedee! Alice is surprisingly overcome and impulsively throws her arms around both of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're sure surprised to see you, too! (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 76.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, what are you doing here? How did you--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, when we saw how you stood up to that Madame Valery--! If Alice can do that, we thought, what the heck's holdin' us back? This is our honeymoon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was scared, but then, well, you only live once! And as long as we've got each other--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got everything, right? Alice blinks, unaccountably teary eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes you've just gotta follow your heart. Be bold: Let the rest take care of itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard stands with his map beneath the arch where all roads come together in a spinning roundabout of bleating car horns. He looks down the length of the Champs Elysees, overwhelmed. The Japanese couple from Notre Dame approach Richard to ask directions and he shrugs helplessly, pressing the map on them, and steps out as a crosswalk signal turns to green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice embraces Deedee and Carl beside a waiting taxi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell the girls we would have loved to see them, but--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Italy calls! And Greece! We're even thinking of hitting Turkey! Imagine! We'll send you postcards. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 77.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice puts her friends in the taxi, closing the door as Deedee scrolls the window down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enjoy every second of it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, too, honey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bon voyage! The car pulls away, Carl and Deedee turning in their seats to wave at Alice through the rear window. Alice waves until they are out of sight and slowly lowers her hand, standing alone in the street. A beat. Alice sighs and pulls out her guide book, unfolding a map as she looks up to gather her bearings. She takes in the quiet street, the view of the ocean, then looks back at the map in her hands. She straightens up, a new look of purpose on her face, and crosses the street to toss her guide book and map in the trash can on the corner, striking out unaided down a narrow twisting street hung with vines and flowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice rounds the corner of one street into the tight intersection of two narrow alleys in the fading twilight. She looks around,.cheeks flushed, hair pasted to her forehead, lost in a maze of dilapidated walled courtyards and apartment blocks; home to the city's service workers. She hesitates, then forges ahead down one street until she sees that it dead ends, and she doubles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice suppresses panic as she walks briskly up a steep alley, high in the hills, trailed now by a small stray DOG. She stops, turns to the dog that also stops then sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is Go. Go home. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 78.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and starts forward, the dog following. Alice stops again, turns, and the dog sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't follow me. I have no idea where I'm going... The dog cocks its head in comment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay? Alice turns to climb the street's incline. The dog follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Penelope, dressed for the evening, gets up from reclining on the bed to join Emma who models a gown before a mirror. The two regard Emma's reflection, cocking their heads in an identical manner at precisely the same time. Penelope draws a necklace in gesture, indicating Emma's bare collar bone. Emma turns, lit by an idea, and pulls the'steel briefcase from its hiding place beneath the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg opens the door from the street, stepping inside, wearing the sexy jeans she hadn't bought the day before. Bernards's father makes his way to meet her with menus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madame?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just one. He leads her to a table along the wall and holds out a chair. Seated, Meg follows him with her eyes to the kitchen where Bernard works furiously at the stove, tossing the contents of a sauce pan with an expert flick of his wrist. Bernard glances out to the dining room, seeming to sense Meg before knowing he'll find her there. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 79.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg matches the broad smile that sweeps Bernard's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pair of strolling LOVERS draw Richard's attention as he massages his stockinged foot at a sidewalk table. He watches them stop, kiss, then continue on their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: returns with Richard's change on a plate and Richard fits his shoe back on his foot, gathers his things to stand. He stops when he notices the front page of a newspaper folded on a chair at the next table. He quickly unfolds it to the photograph of Alice and Meg with Emma in the fountain, scans down to the caption: Cordelia Scott and friends in Monte Carlo. Hotel de Paris, etc...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice feeds the little dog a scrap of meat as she eats a kabob, seated on the curb by a street vendor's food cart around which ALGERIAN MEN lounge in plastic lawn chairs. The dog looks at her avidly, hungry for more. Alice holds her kabob stick out for the dog to eat, surrendering her dinner with pleasure. As Alice sips from a bottle of beer, a soccer ball bounces off the curb and rolls to a stop beside her. She looks up as a ragtag BAND OF KIDS call from the dusty lot across the street, asking for their ball. A beat as Alice regards the ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma wears Cordelia's elaborate necklace, standing alone, within a throng of PARTY GOERS, all conversing in French. she nods and smiles absently, though she's clearly lost, out of her element, when Giorgio approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is Meg? I do not see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I... I don't think she's 0 coming. I'm sorry. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 80.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma drifts away to the ship's rail where she turns to survey the party, smiling wistfully at Penelope and Domenico locked in intimate conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia! There she is! Cordelia! The trio of paparazzi putter alongside in a small boat, peppering the yacht with their camera flashes. Emma looks out at them, without her usual animation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smile, Cordelia! Please, smile! Emma waves, but can't seem to manage that smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ty v poryadke? Emma turns to find Nikolai standing beside her in white tie, a piece of cake extended in one hand, a fork in the other. Emma's eyes light up as if a switch has been thrown and the flash of a camera records her huge, dazzling smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Niki. He bows slightly, offering the cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You work here too? You never get a night off... He smiles, shaking his head, hands her the cake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya sa-meey shas-li-veey che-lo-vek na zem-le, pa-ta-mu chto u me-nya yest' tee. Emma hangs on every incomprehensible word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vy menya panimayete?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Niki... I'm so glad you found me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 81.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seamus. He's ten. Built a website for his fourth grade class. Now he's got actual clients. And that's Finn, the prima ballerina. She'll be six in June-- Emile examines photographs of Seamus and Charlotte from Meg's wallet while she refills their glasses at the kitchen table and Bernard works at the stove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elle est coquin, oui?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, she's no chicken. She's not scared of anything--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a chicken. He says, she looks like a rascal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No idea where she gets that... Meg lifts her glass with a sly smile as Bernard brings plates of food to the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, that's a nice word for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: m open! I'm open! Alice sails down the makeshift soccer field as one of the kids passes the ball to her, chased by the others. She dodges and kicks the ball through the goal to score. Her "team" jumps and cheers, as do a collection of spectators who have gathered to watch this tall red headed woman in a summer dress racing around the dusty lot with a band of kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go! Go! (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 82.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice races back down the field with her team, the little dog running along and barking from the sidelines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, she is perfectly safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. No. No way. Bernard straddles a beat up moped, motor running, as Meg shakes her head emphatically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can not take you, if you will not get on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to tell you? I'm not getting on that thing. Bernard fixes her with a level look, which Meg mimics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'est bon. Au revoir. He swings a leg over the moped, revs the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - MOVING Meg hangs on to Bernard as they zip along the beachfront drive and turns her face to the wind with a smile. She surrenders to the ride, the sheer fun of it, laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you say "faster?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bernard and Meg, flush from their ride, enter the kitchen through a back door, to be hailed by a half-dozen CHEFS crowded around a table littered with dishes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 83.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The best chefs of Monte Carlo. They come here to drink and show off. The end of every night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (60's, a bear in chef's whites) lumbers towards them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! No! No! We are only cooks allowed here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but, this is why we've come! I have finally found someone who can teach you how to cook! (INTRODUCING) This is Meg, from America. (TO MEG) And this is Henri, the worst egotist, my mentor. The two men embrace, merrily kissing each other on both cheeks, then Henri pulls Meg under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turns to the table) A chef from America! Come to flip hamburgers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - MOVING Jean-Pierre drives an open silver sports car full of PARTY GOERS down the twisting streets, when he sees the commotion and crowd around the dirt lot. Then he spots Alice running-around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice sticks like glue to a kid with the ball, maneuvers in, steals the ball, and doubles back in the opposite direction, racing up the field as the crowd laughs and claps. She passes the ball to kid who drives it to the goal, scores. Alice looks up from the game at the tapping of a car horn to see Jean-Pierre honking in celebration as he leans against the car with his GUESTS, enjoying the game. Alice stops to wave, and takes the ball full in the face. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 84.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean-Pierre's smile winks out as Alice drops and he races from the car as worried kids and spectators form a circle around Alice's prone body. The little dog licks Alice's face and she opens her eyes. She leaps up as Jean-Pierre crosses the lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm up! I'm up! Let's go! She sets off down the field with the kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Empty and half-filled glasses, bottles litter every surface along with plates, ashtrays, crumpled napkins. Emma sits on the lower landing deck, legs in the water, shoes in her hand, looking out at the lights. Nikolai moves his legs in the gentle current beside her, tuxedo trousers rolled, while he concentrates on working a napkin into intricate folds. Emma turns to look back at the silent boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't seem fair. Leaving you to clean up all alone. (THINKS) I'll help. But, you've really got to talk to your boss. Nikolai laughs, shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya ryadom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It must get kind of lonely sometimes... Not being understood. (PAUSES) I know how that can feel. Nikolai holds up the napkin he's transformed into a crown adorned with flowers and the wire cages from Champagne corks. Emma looks at him, her face soft and vulnerable, open, as Nikolai places the makeshift crown on her head with care. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 85.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My princess. They look at one another for a beat, then simultaneously turn to the sea and the frail sky, awaiting the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get me. Nikolai looks down at his hand on the edge of the deck next to Emma's, and turns it palm up in invitation. Emma places her hand in his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg tries to follow the discussions and familiar teasing of the chefs as they pass plates, goading her to taste. She looks over at Bernard, who smiles as he holds his hands up at the scene, his boisterous friends, the food; as though to say "this is good, enjoy." Meg relaxes her shoulders and gives in to the spirit of the table, spears a bite of food and lifts her glass to Bernard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg and another chef, locked in a chopping duel, plow though onions at a blinding pace, their knives flashing, creating an escalating staccato on their cutting boards. Meg sweeps her onion from her board to a pan, and slams her knife down in victory as all the chefs erupt with applause. Henri seizes Meg's hand, raising her arm in the air, and presents her with a bottle of wine. Meg turns to Bernard, beaming, thrilled, utterly happy, as the other chefs clap her on the back, shake her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jean-Pierre opens the door at the top of the fire stairs, revealing the open sky, turning back to take Alice's hand. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 86.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) What's the most amazing place you've ever been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Hard to say. There are many. Alice steps out onto the hotel's roof with Jean-Pierre's jacket over her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Well, Africa, then. How often do you get to go? He leads her around the maze of skylights to the front of the building that faces the sea and the lightening sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) Not enough. Mostly I am on planes. To the places where sunlight and parties make people generous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice's smile flickers with a vague disappointment as she leans against the hotel's crown beside Jean-Pierre. ALICE That seems a shame...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, I can think of one place I have never been. It is in my imagination only, so it is very special. He places an arm around Alice as they take in the view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is just a small town, in a vast, open space. Maybe in the middle of America. There are people there like yourself, who are kind. And children who have everything they need. Alice turns to Jean-Pierre as he takes a strand of her hair in his fingers, and they hold a beat, looking at one another.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In my mind, it is bordered by fields that are green. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 87.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice breaks the moment by turning her head to search the far horizon just as the rising sun crests the open sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikolai shrugs himself out of his formal shirt to stand before Emma in nothing but starfish printed boxer shorts. He lifts his hands: This is me. Here I am. Emma hesitates, then lets her gown fall around her, bare except for her panties, the necklace, and her napkin crown. Nikolai pushes himself off the side of the boat at a run, hiking up his legs into a cannonball. SPLASH! He surfaces and turns back to the boat just as Emma dives in with a SPLASH! She swims to Nikolai, pushing him under in a child's game, and he pops up, spitting water like a fountain. They laughs and Emma loops her arms around him. A beat as they sober. Emma pulls Nikolai close to her, and they kiss. On the landing deck, Emma's gown shimmers in the morning sun with Nikolai's crown and Cordelia's yellow gem and diamond necklace nestled among its satin folds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, still wearing Jean-Pierre's jacket, walks down the hall with Jean-Pierre close beside her, neither speaking. She turns to him when they reach the door of her suite. A long beat stretches, full of every possibility.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Dubai. I leave the day after--. What is today? Friday? I leave tomorrow. You could come too. You wouldn't need to bring anything. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 88.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But--. Jean-Pierre... (a near confession) You don't know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is why I ask. I would like to know you, Alice. Very much. Alice regards him a beat, then slowly pulls his jacket from her shoulders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before this, I'd never even been to France. Jean-Pierre blinks and Alice laughs, as much at herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true. Just kept putting it off. Always managed to find an excuse. But, really, it was that I was afraid. That it couldn't ever live up to the France I'd imagined. And if it did... Then I'd never be able to go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, now? Alice gently places Jean-Pierre's jacket in his hands and steps near to kiss him on the lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, thank you. She turns and opens the door with her key as Jean-Pierre smiles ruefully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For everything. Alice steps into her room and closes the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard exits the plane, walking down a mobile stairway onto the tarmac, carrying Alice's repaired suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 89.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard stands at the information counter, conferring with an
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in his broken French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excusez-moi...I'm looking for the train. To Monte Carlo. Behind him, Cordelia strides through a set of doors to stop directly at Richard's back as she searches the terminal and hisses into her cellphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Daddy, I'm here. No, I do not see a driver. Yes, I am looking! The attendant points over Richard's shoulder to an exit. Richard begins to turn in Cordelia's direction, but the attendant corrects him, pointing the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merci. He picks up Alice's suitcase and heads off just as a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches Cordelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mademoiselle Scott?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where have you been? The driver leads her away, neither she nor Richard having taken note of the nearby newsstand and its display of today's front page: Emma on the yacht wearing Cordelia's necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg zooms the moped around the fountain a last loop, Bernard on the back, before jerking to a stop in front of the hotel. Bernard steadies the moped as Meg climbs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, this is me. Back to the old Grimaldi suite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to open the restaurant. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 90.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beat as they face each other, neither knowing how to end the evening, how to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank your father for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will, Meg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Meg hugs him briefly, awkwardly, then turns for the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Meg. Meg stops, holds a beat with her back to Bernard. Then she turns and marches to him with purpose, seizing his face in both her hands and kisses him passionately. She releases Bernard, who staggers against the moped, catching himself just before going over, as she turns again for the steps, an enormous smile on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL DE PARIS - SUITE - DAY Alice sits on the edge of the bed with the hotel phone, idly looking out at the sparkling bay and anchored boats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (leaving a message) Well, I wish you were there. Or here. I wish you were here, Richard. I do... Because I keep thinking, no matter what I see, I'm only seeing half of it. Because we're not seeing it together... Meg lets herself in the front door and heads for the bedroom, stopping when she overhears Alice on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Richard. I hope you'll be there when I get home... Because that's all I want. Alice hangs up the phone, so lost in thought she doesn't see Meg standing at the door. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 91.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Alice looks up, smiles to see her friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Hey-- (taking Meg in) Hey! You bought the jeans! They look great--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tearful, comic) Alice, I am so sorry! For what I said. About you. And Richard. I didn't mean any of it! I love you. I don't know how I would've gotten through the past six months if it weren't for you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. It's okay. You were right-- (bursts into tears) Oh, Meg! I made a huge mistake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wha--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard asked me to marry him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait. What? When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told him we should wait a week!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You didn't--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did! He surprised me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd imagined him asking me a million times, but then when he did, I just panicked. suddenly all I could think about was the trip. (MORE) (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 92.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That I hadn't already been to France. It was like this wave, all the years, and chances I'd had but didn't take, they just crashed down on me: And I hadn't seen anything but the end of Lake Avenue. The only clear thought in my head was, "this guy is so wonderful, how can he marry half a person?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Alice. You were going. We were on our way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought he was asking me to make a choice. But, he wasn't. He wasn't doing that at all. It was me. Because I couldn't believe he loved me just for who I was. France or no. (PAUSES) All I had to do was say, "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, Richard knows you... It might feel like it's over. But, it's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really ruined it this time... The suite's doorbell rings and they both look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice opens the door for Emma who stands up from retrieving the morning paper just outside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hands off paper) Thanks. I couldn't find--. I musta left my key someplace... (on a cloud) But, what does it matter, really? When I already have everything I'll ever need... Alice exchanges a look with Meg as Emma swans across the suite to tear open on the fruit basket, pluck out an apple, and drape herself across a chaise. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 93.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is EMMA (CONT'D) Moooorning, Meg... (back on track) For the first time in my life, everything makes perfect sense, you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying to follow you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in love! I am! Oh, you guys, I'm in love with Niki... Nikolai... Nikolai. And, I don't care if he is just a busboy. Or waiter. Whatever he is... Alice unfolds the paper, taking in the image of Emma wearing Cordelia's necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's funny if you think about it. I could have had a prince. A real one. But, I wanted my Niki-- (a big bite of apple) Hey. Why are you guys crying? This is good news!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought we said no jewelry--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No--? What jewelry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Alice holds up the newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooh, that's a good one!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The necklace, Emma! Emma's face clouds as she distractedly reaches a hand to her bare collar bone, then flicks her eyes up to Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma, where's the necklace--? (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 94.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma leaps up and races to the window, throwing the doors 0 wide as Alice and Meg dash after her onto the balcony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The yacht! There! I left it on--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding me?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Cordelia! Cordelia! They look directly down to the base of the hotel where the trio of paparazzi call as Cordelia emerges from a limousine. Alice and Meg look at each other, stricken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hey. What's she doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia strides across the lobby, passing WORKERS who set up for the auction, and arrives at the front desk. A busy DESK CLERK glances up, brightening happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mademoiselle Scott! Cordelia looks at him with typical, withering disdain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The driver was late. The clerk's smile falters, fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? I'm checking in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, Emma and Meg race around, frantically grabbing clothes, stuffing them into shopping bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The elevator doors open and Cordelia steps off with a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: toting her bags, as her cell phone rings. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 95.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The three women scramble though the suite, collecting, straightening, smoothing in a blind panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bellhop stops outside the door with Cordelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beijing? Oh, I want to come! Will you wait for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Alice, Meg and Emma freeze in their tracks at the very center of the suite, their heads swinging toward the door when they hear the key inserted from the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bellhop opens the door, holding it wide for Cordelia who marches in to the room...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .where everything, impossibly, appears to be in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can be there in, say, a day-- (TO BELLHOP) I was meant to have a suite. (INTO PHONE) Of course, they've screwed this up as well--. Who else is going? The bellhop opens the bedroom doors, revealing the tower of Cordelia's luggage, crowned by the reassembled fruit basket. Cordelia, unimpressed, indicates the bags the bellhop holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put those with the others-- (INTO PHONE) Wait, wait! She spins away for the French doors, twisting their handles, and throwing them wide. Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 96.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia steps to the railing, completely unaware of Alice, precariously perched atop the adjacent balcony's railing, back pressed against the face of the hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stavros is supposed to be here, isn't he? I don't see his boat! Alice carefully turns to Meg and Emma who look back her with desperate faces from the balcony on the far side of Cordelia, where they balance with their shopping bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Mademoiselle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Majorca?! Hold on. She does a quick turn, marches inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bellboy stands expectantly by the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? He nods, not quite with his hand out, but waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're done, you may go. The bellboy turns but hesitates in catching a quick glimpse of Alice, fleet as a gazelle, as she passes the open doors on the balcony behind Cordelia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, you can go. He bows a retreat, backing out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice climbs across to the next balcony where Meg tries the handles of another set of French doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're locked! (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 97.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They each look about for a route of escape. Emma looks down, on the heads of the unsuspecting paparazzi while Alice scrutinizes the facade above. Alice looks at Meg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Forget it. Alice laces her fingers together, turning to Emma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma, help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're first. There's a door on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The roof?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shopping bags swing up over the edge of the roof, landing in profusion, followed by three sets of gripping hands. Alice, Meg and Emma haul each other over the hotel's crown, the view of the ocean and the yachts in the bay behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in uniform passes a captain's hat to Nikolai, who places it on his head as they speed towards the marina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg turns to get a gauge on the distant yacht as she and Alice labor with the oars of a fisherman's dinghy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd they have to park so far out, anyway?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One point five million Euros, Emma! (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 98.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said I was sorry! You think I would have worn it if I knew how much it cost? Busy fighting, none of them notice as Nikolai's boat passes fifty feet off their side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I going to tell my kids?! How am I'm going to explain to Glenn that we're in a French jail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the auction, Emma!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My kids'll be in college when we get out! They won't even know me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of us knew that, Alice--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trespassing. Burglary. Oh, god. Grand larceny, by trick and DECEPTION-- ALICE For the children--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Africa. I know!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm standing in a stolen boat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sit down then! Nikolai's wake hits the dinghy, rocking them hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard steps off the train, with today's paper wedged under the arm that carries Alice's suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dinghy strikes the side of the yacht and the three women scramble to their feet, grasping the side of the boat. Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 99.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was right here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I can't believe this... Meg doubles over, hands on her knees as Emma stands over the empty spot on the landing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you even sure you took it off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Definite "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... Were you this close to the edge? I mean, it could've fallen--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not even say it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I'm getting a little tired of this. Just because I SOMETIMES FORGET-- ALICE Emma, we're not talking about a pair of sunglasses!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have time for this! Let's just split up! Alice you go fore, Emma take the aft, and I'll check the cabin. Emma glares at Alice with steely, narrowed eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Fine. (PAUSES) Which way is aft?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clerk looks up as Nikolai arrives at the front desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes? (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 100.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya khotel by perepisyvat'sya s vami.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excusez moi, monsieur?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice, Meg and Emma reconvene in the cabin's salon, each coming from a different direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice boat. No necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he, anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just works here. I don't-- (an idea forming) You don't think he could have taken it, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows?! I mean, is there anyone who understands a word he says?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, this could all be my fault! He probably thought he needed it, to finance our new life together. The temptation was just too much for
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emma, it's your fault because you wore it in the first place!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He works like fifteen jobs already! You don't know what it's like being around rich people all the time--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, we do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 101.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikolai picks up the hotel phone as he removes Emma's room key from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pozhalujsta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gratitude, Mummy. That's what I'm talking about. It's just so unfair the way Daddy assumes I've nothing better to do than-- The hotel phone rings, interrupting her complaint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on. She picks up the ringing telephone at the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What? (LISTENS) I cannot understand you. She hangs up, heads for the fruit basket with her cell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mummy, Mummy, I'm just saying I wish someone, anyone, would consider my feelings. Just once. She snatches up an apple from the basket without looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go ask him how much he thinks a simple "thank you" might cost. She hangs up her cell with a sniff and raises the apple, stopping when she sees where Emma has eaten. She recoils, dropping the apple, which rolls across the carpet and hits one of Emma's sandals beneath the desk. Cordelia approaches, looking down to discover the other sandal in the wastebasket, along with Emma's broken plastic tiara, room service dishes, and the newspaper. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 102.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia pulls the newspaper from the trash, curiosity turning to shock as she takes in the huge torn photograph of Emma wearing her necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The women paddle back towards the Marina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we're just going to have to talk to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah, that was the first thing that struck me about her. How reasonable she seemed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (seizing on the idea) Yeah, we'll just explain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should have sailed that yacht right back to Wisconsin--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it was an accident. This whole
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think she'd fit in one of those trunks of hers--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just thinking out loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never know. She might understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cordelia slams the steel briefcase onto the bad, scrabbling at the combination lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! She rips the lid open to reveal the empty velvet lining and she SCREAMS! Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 103.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard pays a taxi driver, taking Alice's repaired suitcase, and mounts the steps directly behind Domenico escorting Penelope through the revolving door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Domenico and Penelope head for the ballroom entrance and Richard arrives at the front desk, just as the clerk's phone begins to ring. Richard holds up the newspaper with Emma's photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to find this woman-- The clerk puts up a finger as he lifts the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Une moment, Monsieur. Pardon. Behind Richard, Nikolai crosses from the bank of house phones for the elevator, stopping to pluck a flower from the lobby's arrangement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on hotel phone) Send security! Immediately! This is Cordelia Winthrop Scott. I've been robbed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikolai steps into the elevator, the doors closing, just as Alice, Emma and Meg throw themselves through the lobby's revolving door. At the desk, the clerk hangs up one phone to pick up another, stalling Richard again with his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon. (INTO PHONE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clerk stops, spotting Emma as she, Alice and Meg, sprint past the front desk and Alice wipes out, tripping over her own suitcase on the floor beside Richard. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 104.

direction.raw_text: First prize. To the champion. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 12 6.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikolai takes Emma's hands in his up on stage. EMMA (scared, shaky) Niki? What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya das-ta-nu to-be zvyoz-dee. Emma nods, without any real understanding, as he indicates the necklace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is my gift. For you. Emma's eyes slowly come into focus as it all becomes clear-and she FAINTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Together, Alice, Meg and Emma offer an envelope fat with Euros to Jean-Pierre. They stand, with Richard, Bernard, Nikolai, Penelope and Domenico, beside a waiting sedan at the base of the hotel's steps where the trio of paparazzi shoot away. ALICE This is for our room. And the trip down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest is for the schools. Jean-Pierre hesitates in accepting the envelope, but Alice presses it on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are all extraordinary women. (TO RICHARD) I wish you much happiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Meg turns to Bernard, holding up the bottle of wine, as Richard places Alice's suitcase in the trunk with their shopping bags. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 127.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You come to Wisconsin, we'll drink this in my kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. They embrace and Meg turns with Alice to Emma who stands arm in arm with Nikolai.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, Emma, you're sure about this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you both as soon as I know. They may have to get a sub at school for a couple of weeks, but, oh, you guys, I swear it sounded like a proposal! Alice and Meg turn to Nikolai who grins and nods away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Yes!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOTEL DE PARIS - FRONT DRIVE - MOMENTS LATER Jean-Pierre closes the car's door with Alice, Meg and Richard inside, stepping back to join Emma, Nikolai, Bernard, Penelope and Domenico, who watch as the car pulls out. Together, they wave their friends away. Jean-Pierre shakes hands with Nikolai and kisses Emma, tips his head in farewell to Bernard, then enters the hotel with Penelope and Domenico. Emma and Nikolai shake hands with Bernard, then turn and head for the marina, trailed by one of the paparazzi while the other two pause to reload their cameras. As Bernard hops on his moped to zip away, the revolving doors turn and Cordelia steps out, talking on her cellphone, followed by a train of bellhops and luggage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Daddy! It was a huge success-- She stops suddenly, as if struck, and her expression of perpetual anger melts away as she listens, blinks. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 12 8.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (DEEPLY MOVED) Thank you? You're, you're welcome. One of the paparazzi raises his camera to take her picture, but another places his hand over the lens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not her. That's the other one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alice sits between Richard and Meg at the departure gate, each lost in their own thoughts as TRAVELERS pass to and fro. A long beat. A small smile finds its way onto Alice's face and she gently lowers her head to rest it on Richard's shoulder. Richard finds Alice's hand and squeezes it in his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meg walks down the jetway in her skinny jeans, a bounce in her step, shopping bags in one hand, the bottle of wine gripped in the other, as though headed for a party. Behind her, Alice carries her shopping bags and Richard totes Alice's suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: used to wander aimlessly,/ Wanton my goal, grievous my plight./Your dear hands led me, guided me." Alice encircles Richard's waist as they walk, and he slings an arm around her shoulder, kisses her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under a beating sun, Emma, dressed in immaculate white linen, holds hands with Nikolai as a MOB OF LAUGHING CHILDREN and their TEACHERS greet them outside a new Marchand Foundation schoolhouse. (CONTINUED) Monte Carlo Draft 3 - November 4, 2007 129.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) "Over the far horizon, night/ Glowed with the pallid hope of dawn./Your eyes' glance was my morning light."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: presents a length of brightly woven fabric, draping it over Emma's shoulders as Emma picks the girl up and the other children lead Emma and Nikolai inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bulletin board in Meg's classroom is covered in African fabric, photographs and letters, all under a banner that reads: Food Drive for Our Sister School - Zambia. The two students who had cooked their pot holders sort canned goods beneath the board, while Meg cooks, surrounded by the rest of her CLASS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) "No sound - save his own tread upon/The ground - to ease the wanderer's heart./Your voice encouraged me: 'go on!"'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carefully scoops spices with a measuring spoon, holding it out for Meg to add to her pan. She ignores the spoon, instead reaching to pinch some spice with her fingers and encourages the student who follows her example.
direction.name: direction
